title: Man, 65, is feared dead after he drives a bobcat into a Logan dam
text:
A 65-year-old man is feared dead after he drove a bobcat into a dam, leaving him trapped underwater.

Emergency crews rushed to the scene at a South Maclean home in, Logan, Queensland at about 9.30am on Monday.

The driver was helping a neighbour when he accidentally drove into the water.

A Queensland Police spokesman told Daily Mail Australia the man is still in the process of being rescued by authorities and remains underwater.

A 65-year-old man is believed to be dead after he drove a bobcat into a dam, leaving him trapped underwater

Emergency crews rushed to the scene at a South Maclean home in Queensland at about 9.30am on Monday

The neighbour, in his 50s, sustained minor injuries and was taken to Logan Hospital, where he remains in a stable condition.

A report is being prepared for the coroner.
description: Emergency crews rushed to the scene at a South Maclean home in, Logan, Queensland at about 9.30am on Monday.
authors: Paula Ahillon For Daily Mail Australia
